Dam little kids beat me on some of this stuff! but i am a noob at this. good trails.

A nice, but small gym best suited for kids and those looking to boulder. Pros - friendly staff, relaxed atmosphere, tunnels for the kids, tons and tons of bouldering problems with a wide range of difficulty.Cons - this is not for those looking to top rope - few routes, short climbs, those annoying levered belay devices, and difficulty is overestimated.  very little supervision or safety oversight, and at times difficult to find the one person that seems to be working.  very crowded feelMy disclaimer is I only climbed indoor the day I visited.  I've been to several other gyms, all of which I would pick before returning here.

I bought a groupon for this place and it was money well spent. My friends and I are hooked. This place is decent size with many routes at different skill levels. Everyone there is super nice and wants to help you succeed. I never heard so many "there is no trying, just do it" in my life. It gets crowded on the weekends and tuesdays, but the workout and the company is worth it.

Great exercise, it's fun, open 7 days a week and challenging.  Down side, it's a bit stinky...like lysol and rank feet, stinky.They have a cave like tunnel you can crawl through, have a flashlight as its pitch dark and you can drop a pretty good way if you aren't careful.  If you're claustrophobic uhhh hahaha don't even think about doing it!

Been climbing here with a Groupon. I started out at ClimbX. The staff is super friendly. There's a lot of bouldering and some you can reach the top and climb over. They don't use ATCs here for climbing just the Grigris attached to a rope anchored to the floor so climbers just clip in. Very easy to use. The routes here are challenging and fun. I've haven't really encountered super crowded nights except when they just had a class. They also have some fun tunnels that you can climb through with a flashlight or glow stick. I thought the place was clean enough as rock climbing gyms go. Everyone is very friendly and welcoming and as a beginner that's really encouraging. Would definitely recommend. They are also much cheaper than Rockreation.

I've been going here for years and I absolutely love it!This is an awesome climbing center in Orange County.  The routes are fun and challenging to your liking.  I climb until my mind is clear and my grip is weak.  I leave feeling refreshed and wake up the next day feeling satisfied and sore -- well, maybe being sore just tells me how unfit I actually am.  In any event, you get a total body workout with upper body, core, and lower body.  On top of that, you get to have fun!  I highly recommend making a trip to Rock City.  Good for groups!

Rock City is Awesome.  The staff is as friendly as it gets.  There's a reason this place gets so packed!They change up the courses and difficulty every couple of months so it doesn't get repetitive, you'll always want to come regularly since each climb is always a little different.They have affordable annual passes so that is something to look into if you live locally.  Invest in some rock climbing shoes and you are all set! Rock climbing is a great way to exercise, build some muscle, and exert some energy!

Now that I've been to 7 or so rock gyms (others: UCI rock wall, Rockreation Costa Mesa, Hangar 18 Signal Hill, Hangar 18 South Bay, Mesa Rim San Diego, Planet Granite Sunnyvale), I feel a little more comfortable with reviewing them. Rock City is thus far my least favorite rock gym, for top-roping (I only top-rope right now, though I hope to learn lead sometime next year).I was aghast by how run-down and dirty the place was, first of all. They needed more cubbies too. But more importantly, the Gri-gris there were difficult to use, leading to very unpleasant, jolting lowerings from the wall. They seemed old and were also attached to the floor in a strange manner. Next, the walls across from each other were often situated so close together that descending or falling climbers would swing into other climbers or belayers. I haven't really seen this issue elsewhere. I don't want to hate on children, but there were a lotttt of children here as well, which made the climbing experience very loud/noisy. The rock walls were short and lacked features, and the holds were often insanely slippery; they were probably decades old...or sweaty? In addition, it was hard to see the route while climbing because routes were indicated by tape rather than the color of the holds. The placement of the tape (under the rock) inhibited the visibility of the tape.The routes themselves were difficult, to say the least. The 5.10s were mostly not marked by subcategories. I tried all the 5.10s and managed to complete maybe 3 or so (this was back in July/August), while totally failing on most. 5.9s weren't too easy either. I slipped off the rocks several times during my climbs. On the plus side, I enjoyed the climbing rope, as well as the relatively cheap prices (I believe it was about $14 for a day pass)...but I would pay a couple more dollars in a flash to go to another gym. I see that this gym has an overwhelming proportion of very positive reviews, and I have wondered why. After perusing the reviews, I believe that positive reviews may be from boulderers or from new climbers (when I was there, I noticed that no other top-ropers were actually climbing routes...). Verdict: Hate the gri-gris here, the slippery rocks, difficult-to-see route markers, noisiness, and spacing issues. Pass.
So awesome! Everyone is really nice and always helpful. There's a ton of paths of all skill levels. So fun!

This place holds a special place in my heart as this jump started my love for bouldering in 2009. The owner, Sean is hella chill. And yes I'm very biased towards bouldering so of all the indoor rock gyms, this is the spot for bouldering. It has a homely feeling to it and everyone there is super friendly. Yes it's a tight fit for everyone but it allows you to bond with everyone.Oh go in that tunnel maze thing by one of the bathrooms. Super fun in the pitch dark. The only con I can think of is th real lack of top roping
Got a great deal on a two month membership! Includes shoes, harness, and all the climbing you want to do!

This place is awesome. Great prices and awesome workers. The gym itself is smaller than other places I've climber at but other places are typically much more expensive. A day pass is $12 and rental shoes cost $3 if you don't have your own. If you are a beginner I definitely recommend this place because it's not too intimidating and the prices are good.

Well the climbing is good.got 2 months of membership.that was cool pretty nice gym.however moved away and tried to cancel my membership 3 times and all 3 times got told they would do it but never have.so 200$ later they still haven't.gonna give them one more time and then report them to me credit card company

I first got into this when a friend of mine told me about the Groupon deal for a 2-month membership for this place.I've always had an interest in rock climbing but I've never had an incentive nor the money to do it, but after I started I instantly became addicted to rock climbingI didn't care about climbing alone because of two reasons.One is that I love the sport and it's ridiculously fun.The second is the community here is absolutely fantastic from the employees to the regulars. It really is my second home.No regrets whatsoever!

My background: beginner at bouldering and intermediate at top rope.  I've been to Mesa Rim at Mira Mesa, San Diego and Rockreation at Costa Mesa.  Rock City's atmosphere:Out of the three gyms I visited, Rock City is a perpetual college party - the equipment are abit worn, floor mats ripped up, and the atmosphere is very casual and laid back.  There are lots of climbers who not just go there to climb, but socialize as well.  There is definitely a scene going on, which can be quite fun after getting to know the people.  For some reason, the people are generally younger than the community at Rockreation.  It has a "classes are out" vibe.  I go there after work, and I felt like I am the "old man who is no longer cool" in Rock CityRock City - a great bouldering gym - ok for top rope, and avoid lead climbing :Rock City Climbing Center is a great place to boulder.  Its top rope walls are fine, but this is a boulder gym first and foremost.  Rockreation's top rope walls beat Rock City by variety and height.  At Rock City, most of the people at nights and weekends are there to boulder, leaving the top rope area open unless there are kids / boy-scout / girl-scout parties.  This gym uses the automatic locking belay device, which can be very handy.  When the place gets packed, lead climbing becomes hazardous - there are only a few (2-3?) lead climbing paths, and those paths run directly on top of the main room.  At any given time, there would be 2-3 people below the lead climber.  The boulder routes are re-done once every 2 months.  Which means there are always new problems to solve.  For beginners, there are plenty of VB, V1+, V2+ problems.  There is also many challenging routes (V6 / 7 overhang problems).The gym is quite small - think of three Starbucks put together.  Pricing: This is the most affordable rock gym I've visited.  However the routes are more challenging than some of the other gyms.  Overall, I think Rock City great training center for bouldering, if one doesn't mind the crowd during prime time.  I would go to Rockreation or Mesa Rim if top rope and lead climbing are my thing.

This place is a complete reality check for me.  I thought what a great deal on Groupon, let me try it out, it shouldn't be that hard...boy was I wrong. I like to think of myself as a buff chick but I was proven wrong. I lack in upper body strength period...haha!!! Aside from the lack of cool air seeing that it is inside a warehouse, it was a great workout.  Rock climbing makes you use muscles you weren't even aware were important , such as your fingers.The instructors are very nice and helpful and layout is pretty intense.  The people there are helpful and more then happy to show you the ropes.  I have seen this deal on Groupon several times. I would recommend purchasing it or even signing up and joining.  It's a great workout and definately different from the day to day goings of the gym.

I've been here quite a few times and I have to say, I get a good work out every time. The workers here are pretty lenient and are super friendly. They give you a quick five minute lesson on belaying. This place plays good music and has a really cool tunnel system. I really like the bouldering terrains; some routes are easier than others. This place is definitely an interesting spot to hang out and you can watch people with hot bodies be Spidermen. The atmosphere is really easygoing and it's kind of secluded so there's usually not too many people, aside from little kiddie parties.
Great place to start out climbing. The staff friendly and very helpful.  It felt like climbers of all levels are welcome. The only problem is that in the evenings it tends to get to busy.

This is my home gym! Looked for a few local Orange County and north county gym and this has been the best! It's fairly spacious and has a lot of routes, but sometimes it'll seem like you can't climb any routes! It's bigger than rock recreation and climbx, but it stinks and it's hot.

Quite impressed with the facility and the staff.  The equipment was in good condition and it was well worth the $15.  They offer free climb, their own cave maze, and of course, harness assisted climbs.  Only complaint is that the place smells like a well used sneaker :(

Ive been climbing since 2010 and Rock City is where I started. Since then, Ive climbed at both Hangar 18s, both Vital locations, Threshhold, Truhold, and several outdoor climbing spots.Unbiased Opinion (sort of)This gym is the best climbing gym to get your feet wet in the climbing world(If that is something you choose) for the following reasons:-Cost: You wont find a better deal for a membership anywhere especially for what you can accomplish at this gym.-Atmosphere: The crowd is fun, and a great place to hang out with your friends before you go out on the weekends. For the most part they play great music, and people go OUT OF THEIR way to help and encourage you. Personally I havent seen that at any of the gyms I listed except for 1(Vital). It makes your climbing experience that much better in the beginning. -Staff: The owner works most of the time during the day, so he's there to see and meet his customers. The Employees are all educated climbers, who can give you endless advice on all things climbing on a begginer-expert level. No one is there to nickel and dime you, and they take the time to teach you the basics of top roping/bouldering.-Route Setting: I personally climb 3's with an occasional hallelujah 4 climb. They have some of the most thoughtful and unique settings that I have yet to experience anywhere else, and on every level of climb. I say that with confidence because I have dear friends that are climbing animals and a few that climb professionally. The top ropes are a nice change up on occasion but the focus of that gym is bouldering period.Rock City vs. Other Gyms:From what I've experienced at my level of climbing, I get a great workout at the other facilities and have never felt so pumped. BUT my sessions are just that.... A workout. I learned all of my technique from the challenges at Rock City, and the advice from the experienced fellow climbers and staff. I live in Mission Viejo/Lake Forest area, and OF COURSE I can climb regularly at a closer facility but I wont. I climb about 3 or 4 times a week (which is a whopping 175 miles on average) if I can, and the cost to drive there has paid for itself for what this gym has given me. If anything I owe them :) I personally feel that if I started anywhere else, I never would have stuck with climbing, which is the trend for my athethletic ventures. Ive made such great friends through Rock City who have helped me become the climber that I am today, and built my confidence to take my experience outdoors. I also owe it to Rock City for helping me find a sport that I would give anything for, and will try to climb for as long as my body can stand. Thanks Rock City for building me into a Climber!

Best climbing gym in the oc. Routes are fantastic, you get to watch scrawny kids flash your project, get beta from some amazingly friendly climber regulars and the staff is always on par. They do everything with a smile, help you out when you need it and scold running children when you're about to barndoor off your route. CLIMB ON BITCHES.Minus one star for lack of top roping. I understand they don't have the space, but a 5 star gym (personally) will have the best of both worlds.
Been coming here for over a year. It is my favorite place to go climb. Friendly staff and everyone is chill and nice. I always introduce my friends to this addicting sport! :P Glad i got hooked.

WOW.  This is by far the best indoor rock climbing place I've ever been to.  I'm still learning, but overall I love this place.  Pros:- Awesome staff- Great hours- Huge facility- Lots of space and even resting areas- A wide range of walls (fun, beginner, to of course advanced)- FUN- They have an indoor cave/tunnel that's actually made for adults... I was shocked at how I really had to work it through the tunnelCons:- Far from my house  :[- It was a little hard to locate at night.  I used the GPS on my Droid phone and it was absolutely wrong.  GRRRR!Also I've heard it can get really crowded, which I don't like... but what can they do... when you rock... you rock... literally.  ;)

Over the years, I have gone to three different climbing gyms, and this one is by far my favorite.The top rope routes are always expertly laid, and the ratings assigned to them are reliable.  They mix up their routes quite often, so regulars don't get bored.  I usually prefer top roping because I like to go up really high, but their bouldering routes here CANNOT be beat.  I actually enjoy bouldering at this place!As far as price goes, it's standard to all other rock climbing gyms, but the friendly staff and great routes make all the difference!

This is where I first went rock climbing! It was a pretty fun experience. They even have tunnels going around inside the walls that you can only go in with 1 other person and a headlight. Be forewarned, it's pretty cramped, so larger people might want to rethink having a go inside their tunnels. The only reason why I'm docking 2 stars is because this climbing gym is really small, seems less clean than other gyms I've been to, and is NOT air-conditioned - a huge downside for me since I realllllly get hot & sweaty when I'm exercising, and having to be in a more cramped space, with lots of people, and just a couple of huge fans placed throughout the space...it's not very conducive for the most optimum indoor rock climbing experience. The people you encounter here really are very friendly and welcoming, though - love the atmosphere of encouragement and affirmation from other climbing enthusiasts.

My friends and I purchased a 2-month unlimited deal from one of those deal sites and made it a weekly ritual to climb and trust each other. It came with harness and shoe rentals each visit so that saved us a lot of money. If you've been to Sender One, you'll think this place is super run down but the supportive community vibe here is jammin'. The walls aren't nearly that high and there's not much opportunity for lead climbing but there's several different rooms for bouldering and top roping. Also in the main room, there's two ropes for climbing and a bunch of other apparatuses hanging from the ceiling to just dangle off of and work on your arms/shoulders. It may just be the summer weather but it gets really hot and poppin' at night. If you go on a Sunday morning, you pretty much have the place to yourself. I'm not sure how often they reset the routes, but they completely redid a room during our two-month stay. There's one guy at the front "desk" during any time; Gavin was usually the guy running the show while we were there and he is an extremely affable guy, very helpful.

First, I want to say, I'm not a boulderer. I actually have a fear of heights, so when there's no rope i have to deal with sucking it up and trying to get to the top. I came her cause this was my friends gym. They have a great community here. I'm not even a local and I met 3 different people on the first night! The staff is super chill and let me in for free! The members of the gym all know the staff personally and would consider them friends! The routes are a bit on the tougher side. They definitely have a lot of negative walls/over hang and only had a couple VBs. The routes seemed taller then what I am used too. I suggest if you love bouldering, check this place out!

I called the day before to ask about a family outing at the ropes course. Was told to fill out the waiver in advance and that we could show up the next day. Drove an hour to get to the wrong location. Ropes course address is not in the website. The staff at the gym said the manager doesn't give information on the ropes course. Finally found the course by accident and then no one was there. Turns out the ropes course is in an RV park but that staff knew nothing about whether the course is staffed. Might be a good course but get better directions and information before you venture out.

I've climbed at ClimbX and Rockcreation and they both have nothing compared to the atmosphere here at Rock City.  Everyone is cool here and the staff is friendly.  The atmosphere here is supportive and can push you to climb better lol.  I havent tried any top roping or rock climbing as I mainly boulder.  I got in with a group and saved a few bucks for an annual pass.It costs like $15 for shoe rental and a bouldering day pass so not too bad.See you there!

Been to three rock climbing places, and this is pretty nice.  If anything, I liked this place a little better than most just because it had a wide variety of walls.  There were definitely beginner, low intermediate, high intermediate, and advanced wallls.  I'm at the most a low intermediate, meaning I can do a vertical climb, but anything with a slight incline backwards is difficult for me.  My friends were knocking out some of those, and I managed one, and therefore, the fact there was a decent amount of beginning walls meant I wasn't just regulated to 2 climbs or left watching everyone climb.  So I appreciated that.A few things unique to Rock City was this tunnel crawl that at times was pretty scary; essentially, you are climbing through most of the walls in the place, and that means some drops and some tight spots when you have to manuever yourself.  It's interesting for sure.  There's also a wall where its like crawling up the crevice of a canyon....another unique thing I haven't seen anywhere.  And as at most rock climbing spots, there are bouldering walls, and those were a tough challenge as well.  In the end, not a bad rock climbing spot for beginners.

I've only been here three times in my life. Two from friend's night and once on a date. So does three visit equate to a sufficient review? I would say so, since I've rock climbed for 2 years both indoors and some outdoors.Whereas other places would mark the paths based on color of the holds AND tape, here it's just the tape color and the difficulty level is rated..lower but it's in fact harder than some of the other gyms out there.It's laid back, it's a workout, and it's near some food places to grab some drinks. Recommended? Yes with blisters to go with it.

Oh man, am I sore today!Never realized that this could be such a good work out, and it doesn't feel like it at all! It was my first time ever doing something like this, but it is something everyone should try at least once!This is place is super cool not only for the bouldering and rock climbing, but they have these built in tunnels in the walls thats like a cross between a obstacle course and tunneling for treasure! There is also a rope you can climb, test out how crazy athletic you can be! By the way, I uh, freaking suck at climbing rope, like a fat kid. Prices are cheap, $17 for all day plus $2 for shoe rental, but you don't have to shoe rental.  I was there for about 2 hours.

Today marks the death of my annual pass to Rock City. Tis' truly a day filled with tears and satisfaction. It was the best purchase of 2010. If you can round up a total of 4 people including yourself to go in on an annual pass, it will only set you back $160 each. Once you are a member you can get discounts on climbing gear to get you started. Buy $50 evolv shoes, $20 on a chalk bag and some chalk, and you are set for the entire year.The bouldering at this gym is beyond EPIC. They add fresh routes constantly to keep your hunger satiated.The friendliest crowd I have ever come across including the staff.

I have never been Rock Climbing before and decided to take my little sister after reading Kevin C.'s review. Rock climbing is definitely harder than it looks. It is a good workout especially for the arms. This place was definitely good for kids. My little sister really enjoyed the caves they had around the place where she can crawl in and out of. A great family activity since there were a lot of parents who took their kids there to wear them out. I will definitely come here again if I'm in the area. The staff was helpful since it was my first time. Climbing with shoes and harness is $19/person and if you decide to go without the harness it is $14/person.

I visited Rock City as a guest on my best friends year membership. It has been over a decade since my last rock wall experience (not a positive one), and I developed a fear of heights shortly there after. Needless to say I was terrified as we began scaling the perfectly color coded paths up the walls, no harness or gear other than shoes and hand chalk. With encouragement from my friend and one of the staff members, I gradually got higher up the wall, and eventually made it over the top! I can't begin to explain how triumphant that moment was, to tackle a fear, and test my limits as a person. The thick pads on the floor made me feel comfortable enough to fall if my arms where about to give out, and the scariness about climbing suddenly went away. We spend an hour and a half climbing that night, and I accomplished way more goals than testing my physical strength alone. I feel that this could be a gym of sorts in its own, and will personally look into getting a membership for myself.

This has got to be one of the best climbing gyms I've been too.  The staff were really great, the people who climb were really cool and gave tips, the prices were cheap, and the walls were really challenging.  What else is there to a climbing gym?

Best rock climbing gym in So Cal.  I've been to the ARC in Arcadia and Rockreation in Costa Mesa, both in terms of availability for beginners and for advanced climbers I recommend Rock City.  I may be a little biased having been a member here for the past couple of years, but any friends I've brought out to try rock climbing have agreed they like Rock City best.The gym consist of a top rope wall, a cave for inclined routes, a top out section, lead routes and lots of bouldering.  As well as a tunnel system that is great for the kids, and even adults.The staff is awesome and very helpful, all of them are climbers themselves and are more than happy to offer beta (climbing advice) for anyone that ask.  The people that climb are great as well, whether it's asking for climbing advice, or letting you bum some chalk.Weekday evenings can get pretty crowded at times, but people are really friendly about taking turns on the wall.  And it can even be helpful when you are working the same problem as someone else.The best part though is the variety in climbing routes.  I've been to other gyms where you can tell there aren't too many setters.  Routes seem to have similar moves or styles to climb through.  At Rock City there are multiple setters, allowing for multiple types of climbing styles.  Big strength moves, crimp routes, delicate balancing routes, campus routes, and some way out of the box thinking routes make for a great selection to choose from.The price is pretty cheap.  $15 for a bouldering pass and shoes, the average gym is $18-20 for the same deal.Lastly, third Tuesday of the month is free for friends of members (up to 4).  A great way to bring in your friends that might want to give it a try.  This is how I actually got hooked on Rock climbing ;).

This is a great place to go climbing. The staff is very friendly, and all of the people who climb there are really nice.They do top roping and bouldering here. Bouldering is more of my thing.The best part for me is taking a break and watching the more experienced climbers attempt more difficult bouldering problems. A lot of the holds look impossible to a newbie like me who can barely finish VBs and V0s.What worries me sometimes, though, is when they have groups with a bunch of little kids. The staff keeps telling them not to run in the gym, but sometimes they do. And then, when they walk around, a lot of the time they don't look around and they walk directly underneath where you're climbing. When you're bouldering, you don't have a person on belay if you fall. When you fall, you fall, and sometimes I'm afraid of falling onto one of those kids.If you're looking for a workout but bored with the usual gym fare, give rock climbing a try. Invest in some good climbing shoes and a chalk bag. Oh, and some tape. Until you develop some calluses (and even afterward), your fingers are going to get pretty tore up."I found out today that blood and chalk create cement."
Had such a great time here! It was my first time, and the worker who helped us was so friendly. It was overall a great experience.

Love this place! Been going for about a year, and love the challenge and work out.   Beginners: This place can be intimidating, but there are plenty of beginner problems to work on! The staff is nice and willing to point them out if you ask. In fact, most of the regulars there are nice enough if you ask. The place might look small, but there's plenty of wall to climb.    For a few bucks, it's worth getting the rental shoe's, so go for it!   You can learn a lot by watching others and coming back a few times.

To start, I love everything about this place! The staff is very nice and helpful. They don't make you feel inadequate when you ask questions. The gym itself has everything I need to help me become a better climber and possibly take my show on the road/on the real deal Holyfield mountains and such. They have a couple of those finger pull-up stations and a huge one at the roll-up door entrance...which is cool because you need to continue to build strength to improve. We purchased a groupon, and I have typically noticed that you're treated a little different when you do. However, this was not the case at Rock City. Everyone was really helpful and for lack of a better word, cool. I particularly enjoyed the instruction received from Gavin. He is a nice and knowledgeable young guy who was our instructor the first day. The other climbers at the gym are nice and helpful also. Everyone is trying to help you find the holds and teach you better ways of climbing, which made it really fun. Some people say that the place smells and its run down, but I didn't think it was any different than any other climbing gym. You get enough people that are sweating in one area and of course it is going to smell :) I didn't have a hard time finding the place either. I'm guessing that most people have some type of GPS or google maps or something anyway if they are on Yelp so shouldn't be difficult. This is a place, while I have climbing gyms much closer to where I live, I will definitely keep using after my groupon expires because of the good atmosphere and nice people.

ROCK CITY is my bouldering temple. Anyone who is an adrenaline junkie like me needs to visit this place. I first went a two months ago when I was invited by my friend who is a bouldering enthusiastic. I've tried rock climbing a few times before and I always liked the experience so I tagged. First off, I have to say that everyone ( staff and rock climbers ) were super friendly, helpful, and supportive! For anyone that isn't very familiar (which I wasn't at all)- bouldering is climbing the walls without harness. The walls aren't hazardously high and the floor is padded pretty well so if you fall, there isn't much danger but still alarming when your up there. This gym has various routes in different colors (you must go up the wall with just the rock in your color) and variation of difficulties ( VB[easiest] to V9 [hardest]maybe even 12 or higher). I could do up to V1, I blame my stubby fingers but I'm working up!They also have imitated caving tunnels that are pretty fun and kinda scary if your claustrophobic. I wish this place was closer to where I live or else I would be there every week. However the distance isn't going to stop me from going there as frequent as I can. I love this place. Staff- 5!Fun factor- 5!Atmosphere- 5!Overall- 6! FYI- there is a 2 day after rule with muscle soreness. I go on Wednesday, feel fine on thursday but... on friday my muscles are screaming for icy hot. Teheh no pain no game

This place was pretty coool. It was my first experience rock climbing so i had an awesome time! The staff that trained my group in the beginning confused the hell out of us so after our "training" we just started doing our own thing. The walls don't go up tooo high but its cool for beginners i guess. There were some that were pretty impossible for myself to climb but all in all i had a good time. Pricing isnt too bad. I paid 15 bucks for 2 hours including a harness. I believe they sell shoes there too but i just came in my regular tennis shoes and i was fine. I hear the shoes they have there help give you a better grip so im sure itd be better to have those. Its also good to have power or chalk in handy in case you get sweaty hands! They also have little cave mazes you can go through. But you definately need some source of light in there cuz its VERY dark. i couldnt see anything so i crawled back out and grabbed my cell phone for light (:  it kind of smelled in there cuz im sure its mostly little sweaty kids that go in there but it was cool. This place gave me a pretty good workout tho. I was sore in places i didnt think was possible! I'll probably check out some other rock climbing places b4 i come back here..its kind of in the middle of nowhere between office buildings so its a bit hard to find. All in all i had a great 1st experience here (:

Please Ignore the reviews about the smell and the carpet,It seems these individuals we're expecting a climbing gym owned by Hilton Hotels. Who complains about a bathroom? Take a dump at home before climbing. Anywhothis place is excellent for bouldering problems, and a bit under par with top roping (which is what I did the first few climbs). Yeah it has a bit of a sweaty feet smell, and some of the carpet covering the padding is slightly torn, but trust me the carpet wont eat you up. Overall the experience my gf and I, as well as my other homies have had was Great. From what I understand the bouldering problems change after a few months so they have fresh routes regularly. I had questions regarding footwork and the regulars were more than happy to answer my questions. As far as the guys working the front desk I only have a complaint about 1 person, and if you go often you'll know who i'm talking about. Anywho I am a beginner and may not know a whole lot about bouldering, but keep in mind that the obstacles in the beginning are what can discourage those starting to climb, and so far my experience climbing at this gym has been beyond what I expected. If you are expecting a luxurious hilton hotel vibe when you come through those doors leave the bitching at the door and just enjoy yourself. I will be returning and hoping to begin a membership soon.Price for bouldering (all day pass) $15.00Shoes Rental $3.00Chalk bag freeChalk $0.50 in a candy dispenser Woo!Sore muscles and blisters: PricelessP.S For those beginning to climb don't invest in expensive shoes since you wont be using your feet correctly and will wear out your shoes quickly.I asked a number of experienced climbers and they suggested either the La Sportiva Mantis, or the Evolv Defy.Happy Climbing my friends.

My employer recently booked a corporate team-build activity here and we had a blast!We had one instructor for 40 of us and the class went by smoothly.  The day began with stretches as I could hear creaking in my bones from the long-overdue flexing and pulling.We followed that with a team-build ground activity.  We passed with minimal casualties (only lost one rock) and dignity intact.  On to the ropes course!Instruction was brief: climb up, make sure you're always clamped into place, and make your way through the suspended cables some as high as 50'!  My favorite was finishing off on the zip-line, my least favorite was the tight-rope like dual cable where I tried to be slick and nearly dangled 50' above the grass.  I was clamped in, but I lost my footing and scrambled like a cat in a swimming pool.  Phew!A 4-star review could have been earned, but some of the equipment was starting to show signs of aging.  Nothing too serious, but one of the helmets provided was strictly sized for the Jolly Green Giant. This is a great place to go if you've done all sorts of other group activities and are looking for a more physical and exciting challenge!  Way better than amusement parks, and much more interactive than a game of bowling or similar!

Im a fan of this place...this was my first time ever doing indoor rock climbing...and me and my friends had a blast...theres different routes you can go up and the're all color coded...the whole vibe is real chill...everybody was real friendly...staff and other people climbing...I really look forward to coming back soon...
I love this gym!  The people are super friendly, everyone is willing to help you learn new climbs and the owner is chill.  Definitely the place to go on a rainy day when you want to wiggle

Loss of one star due to the location being hard to find. It is in the back of a business area. Also the guy that answered the phone didn't give us proper directions. Loss of second star due to lack of customer service. My friend and I asked for assistance. No one was in the front desk for five minutes. A group of guys were sitting in the front so my friend and I decided to leave and take our money elsewhere.Loss of third star for not even being able to try out the climbing center because no one was willing to help us. Could have been a bad night but I was looking forward to coming here since it is the closest place from my house.Fortunately I found a better place to go rock climbing. I would give this place a chance if only next time someone were to be there to help.

Beware: You'll be addicted.  This place is friendly, it's nearby, it's a place to get your climbing on.  I've been to newer, larger, more impressive gyms, but you know, this will likely be the place where I'll stay for a while.  The price is right and it's just relaxed.  I've yet to see them change the courses much, but being somewhat of a beginner, I have plenty to go through before I get bored.

If you are sick of the pretentious nature of some local indoor climbing gyms,  Rock City is the place to go. Shaun, the owner, hires some of the friendliest staff around, Matt, Ken , and Sam, just to name a few are always willing to go the extra mile to help the wayward neophyte climber. Members receive wholesale prices on most gear, so shop what you want at REI then buy through the gym. The gym just opened up an over 3.000 sq. foot extension to their climbing area. There are routes for all levels, extensive amounts of bouldering, top outs, lead climb routes, and top roping. Also there is an super cool cave system that goes all around the facility.  The rates are  more reasonable than other gyms in Orange County making Rock City the cool place to climb locally.Final note the map to the right is incorrect, the gym is off La Palma and  Kellog, between Lakeview and Imperial exits off the 91 freeway.
Can't beat the environment! Awesome people, awesome instructors, and awesome courses for beginners through advanced. If you've never been climbing before i recommend rock city! CJ is awesome :)

Plenty of walls to climb and not that much people when i came on a weekday afternoon. Price is $15 for all day climbing, they even have a mini cave area where you can climb through but it is not for the claustrophobic as its a very tight small vent area.

I'm one of the annoying people Justin P. talks about :)  I take my Junior High students here on occasion and let them go crazy on the courses for a few hours.  What an unbelievable value it is!  Rates are posted on their website, but in general, they are more than reasonable.  Their staff is always friendly and accommodating.  The first time we went, I came with a dozen sugar-amped kids on a Friday night without a reservation, and apparently smack dab in the middle of little Mary's 11th birthday party.  They did not turn us away (haha, I would have!) and seriously bent over backwards to make sure we had a good time.  And it wasn't those scowling-FINE-we'll-take-you responses because we were walking pockets of money, but really sincere, goodhearted service.  They did a great job going over all the safety issues and kept a constant eye on that during the night.  My kids loved the cave system that they had snaking throughout the place, and had a good time testing the waters with the beginner walls, working up to the moderately hard walls, and marveling at the rock climbing gurus that inhabit Rock City.  I think they must have a few rotating apparatuses other than walls and caves in the gym.  The first time we were there, there was a large rope ladder, and now they have this crazy never-ending treadmill wall.

Honestly, I have nothing to compare my climbing experiences to but I can say that this is quite the facility. We have now gone twice and the second time was more enjoyable because I gained a bit more confidence. I recommend purchasing at least the $100.00/10 visit deal because it can get pricey if you pay visit by visit. Pleasant way to spend the evening with your other half.

This isn't my regular gym but my friends are regulars here so I climb here once in a while with them. I wish I lived closer so this could be my go to gym cause this place is awesome! The routes here are way better than routes at other gyms. The climbs here are fun, challenging, and unlike some other places, you don't have to be super tall to finish the climbs.My only complaint is that its a small place. When it gets crowded, the back area can be kind of dangerous to stand around at. They're also VERY limited when it comes to sport climbing. There isn't too much room for top roping either. If you're primarily a boulderer though, this place is for you.

I came here because I got the groupon deal with a friend. We decided to try something new that would keep us active and was fun. This place is great. This indoor rock climbing center has different climbing paths for people of varying skill levels, so anyone can do it. This also allows you to gradually build your climbing skills as you progress to the more difficult routes. They also have an indoor cave route which I didn't try but would like to checkout one day.The staff here is also very friendly and knowledgable about climbing and climbing gear. I don't remember the name of the employee, but he took the time to give us suggestions on climbing since it was our first time and even recommended good affordable gear for beginners which could be purchased at a rock climbing warehouse nearby. I really enjoyed my experience there and plan on getting a yearly memebership. iBottom line: this place is fun, affordable, and a great place to get some exercise.

My first time there was great. They really took time to show me & my wife how everything works. I went a second time and invited a friend too and it was good times!!! I have 10 passes now and will be using them soon. Price is good, courses are challenging. Try the cave too. Great work out.

this place was siiiiiiiickwent here for a friends 25thb day party! HAHA i know!!this was my first time rock climbing of any sort--it was extremely difficult for several reasons:   1. i'm asian and short...so um short arms and legs don't make reaching for rocks especially easy   2. i was not properly dressed. Most ppl were in sweats and bball shorts. I was looking cute, not comfortable :D   3. i figured out later, in order to climb more efficiently, you should keep your body close to the rocks   4. i was also terrible at holding the line for other ppl when they climbed. MAN i'm awesome!!!

Rock climbing Rocks!! This was my 1st experience with rock climbing and I loved it! It's a great place for beginners and super advanced climbers. The facility doesn't look too big at 1st, but there are more than enough walls to climb and some fun caves to crawl through. The harness and ropes are extremely secure and you feel very safe climbing the walls. The floor is also heavily padded for extra safety! An all day pass w/ climbing shoes and harness rental was $19/person. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for something fun and challenging to do! It's a really good workout!

i have a pass and enjoy the comradely. helpful staff/climbers that offer up suggestions and teach technique.  friendly ppl but compared to other climbing gyms equipment seems to be a lil old. although i find if far more fun to just climb without ropes or harnesses.If your going for the first time, don't fret if you only last 30 mins climbing. youll be using muscles you dont use often.  if i recall correctly its about $12 to climb and $3 to rent shoes.  Avoid the 3rd tuesday of every month. Passholders can invite 4 ppl for free.  It can get very congested.  Weekends seem light turnouts with occasional group or birthday climbers. There is a small japanese joint in the same lot that has great cheap chicken bowls :)

i dont goo all too often, but ive been to a few others that are better. the walls here are not very tall, but fun for beginners. Its pretty small and a tight fit, especially if ALL of the USUALS are there. This place has a bunch of groupies, which is pretty cool, but also intimdating when you want to climb the walls theyh're climbing. Eh, good for a local place.

I had 6 months of novas rock climbing experience before I moved. Came to CA and discovered Rock City. The Facilities are extremely small and cramped. The trails that they consider to be for beginners have unrealistically small toe rocks....to the point that it made the path unusable. :( I will continue to look for a place to rock climb as it is one of the best work outs bar none! Sadly .....It looks like I will have to look a little further away. This facility is NOT for those learning to enjoy rock climbing.
Place is fun. However, do not buy a membership. It is a $100 to cancel and the memberships are for a year. Will never go here again.Waste of money

If you are looking to try out some rock climbing, look no further, this place has a friendly staff, awesome equipment and an all around great and welcoming atmosphere.  Came here kind of on a whim after eating in Brea, and am sure glad I did.  When you try to find this place at first it is a bit difficult because it is hidden in a sort of "industrial" section where it looks like there are only warehouses everywhere, so if you are looking for it, don't give up.  Anyways, I walked in with my girlfriend and was immediately greeted by two men behind the counter who were exceptionally nice to us.  We explained that we had never done this before and they seemed glad to assist us.  When we started, one of the guys helped explain all the safety procedures, then proceeded to let us have at it.  The area had a decent amount of people for a Monday, but we were able to find sections for us to climb no problem.  The facility was relatively clean(as clean as you can expect a gym/workout center to be).  We climbed for around 2 hours, and it was an awesome experience.  If you are thinking about trying this out, take the time one weekend to give it a try, trust me, you won't regret it.

As an on-again off-again member for nearly ten years, I have to say that I love Rock City. They have a great staff, great facility, and best of all great clientele. You get to know your fellow climbers and make some great friends, and pretty soon you go not just because it is a great way to stay in shape, but because it becomes a social experience.      At some point in time I've been to almost every climbing gym in Orange county and Riverside County and I can say with surety that while Rock City isn't the largest, it has always had the best set-up as far as routes are concerned. They have a wide variety for all styles and ability levels.      Its always been an enjoyable night when I say to myself "I'm hitting up Rock City tonight," and I've never regretted it yet.

I just started this rock wall climbing thing about a month ago...and already I'm hooked. For years, I've tried to find exercise/workout that wouldn't bore me..and I've found it now. The first gym I tried was Thresh Hold in Riverside. That gym is definitely fun; but it's too far away from me. So I was looking at all my options for a family membership in OC. Rock City has the best deal. I think it's somewhat more challenging, at least from a beginner's point of view, than Threshold. Nonetheless, I have enjoyed it every time I went there. The tunnels are a big hit for the kids. L

OMG this place was REALLY fun! I went with a group of friends and some family and we all had a GREAT time. We really liked the harness climbing, but we still enjoyed the harness-free climbing. The employees were all really nice and helpful and the owner was GREAT! We will definately be going back!! :DDD

I'm a first time boulder so I don't have anything to compare this experience to, but that being said, I felt very comfortable here. Staff were nice and it was a casual and relaxed atmosphere. There was a kids' party going on. The place was smaller than I expected. Another reviewer mentioned it being the size of 3 Starbucks combined. That's about right. Despite the size, there seemed to be a variety of levels of walls to climb. I came with 3 friends and one of them is a regular so he was guiding us on technique and foot placement. All in all, a great workout and reason to get outside the gym (sometimes you just get tired of hamstering on machines or the routine gym classes, right?). This is a breath of fresh air. Also, I felt that it wasn't stinky when I went (on a Friday night). They had the doors open and fans going. Don't expect floral scents, I'm just thankful it didn't smell like feet.
really fun place with a ton of walls to climb. this place is a cool place to go to for birthdays or to 'hang' around

This gym has a ton of different bouldering terrain that keeps the problems interesting.  I was just visiting for the weekend and decided to check out the gym.  The staff was friendly, the routes were fun, and the other climbers were nice once I brought up any conversation.  The owner mentioned that they completely change the routes every 3-4 months which is a huge plus because our gym still has routes up from last year.  The bouldering pads were good enough to fall on, but weren't shiney and new.  But that is what you would expect from a real climbing gym that is being used for climbing.  I never noticed any smell or anything bothersome like that.  Lastly, the price is VERY fair.  Most places charge more, and charge you to do the belay test, etc etc etc.  I thought they were fair in just making sure everyone is safe without the worry of nickels and dimes.
i can't get enough of this place. the workers and climbers are so friendly. great for beginners, great for pros.

lots of fun routes! bouldering is more of the treat here, as sport climbs top out at 20 feet (thats a guess). recently expanded, this means more fun!theres an awesome tunnel that runs throughout the gym, sweet!
